medical_history.chief_complaint: Rapidly fatal disseminated coccidioidomycosis in organ transplant recipients.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 developed sepsis on posttransplantation day 13, with symptoms including fever, respiratory failure, altered mental status, hypotension, and leukocytosis. Adult respiratory distress syndrome developed, leading to his death on day 17. Patient 2 became acutely ill with fever, hypoxemia, and dyspnea on posttransplantation day 17, later developing respiratory failure and dying on day 19.
medical_history.past_medical_history: First patient had cryptogenic cirrhosis; second patient had end-stage renal disease.
medical_history.social_history: First patient had never traveled outside of the southeastern United States; second patient lived in Mississippi and had never traveled outside of the eastern United States.
